Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the fireworks demonstration by describing it as "amazing" and stating that it has "never been equaled in the West."
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove the authenticity or existence of the fireworks demonstration. The video uploader himself admitted to digitally creating the entire show.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the video depicts a real Chinese fireworks demonstration without providing any evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the alternative explanation that the video is a digitally created simulation rather than a real fireworks demonstration.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the video was digitally created by the uploader and does not represent an actual fireworks display.
Understate: There is no evidence of any understatement bias in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim does not falter at times bias as it consistently presents the same information about the video.
